poem.title: The Stannic Verses
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Andid those fee Tin ancientime Swalk upon England's mountains green? To paraphrase: did Jesus Christ bless Britain with his presence When a friend of the family went on a business trip? Did the Aramithean tin man do his Virgil down a pit, Saying "Look lad, this is a vug, no not gehenna, just a gap In the rock of ages"? Cornish with its tin; In the Maronite mass the Punic words of Christ; With its guns the English language will fall silent.
